title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message:
Hi 

I have a macbook that will always chime and very rarely show questionmark folder icon but mostly just black screen with backlight
I have tried the disk in another unit and it is healthy and boots with no issues
According to the client there was no physical nor liquid damage and looking at the board it does look like new
This unit wont progress beyond black screen with usb disk after standart resets

Just looking for a direction here

Kind regards

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: If you hold down options during boot up, does it bring up the menu?

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message:
unfortunatelly not. I thought it was the display but now I get consistent Questionmark Folder
Also it doesnt seem to react to any pram or smc reset. Just stays as it is - black screen for about 5 min and then flashing folder

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: Keyboard broken? testing with a known working keyboard or external keyboard?

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: at least the power button works on the keyboard. Behaves the same with an external keyboard, although it doesnt seem to be detecting it as the capslock lights and num lock do not light up, also tried disconnecting the normal keyboard and only external but no difference

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: have you tried on external (without screen plugged in) ?. i have 3-4 of this same model that no one can seem to get posting video to the internal display. still working on finding a solution to this common issue with these.

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: The question mark should appear after about 30 seconds. Try without SSD and see if this is consistent.

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: I did, same issue :(

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: not consistent i'm afraid. the questionmark folder takes forever to appear (5min +) it is heating up - the unit. Put new thermarpaste but still, very hot within 3 minutes

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message:
Do no use comments, only reply.

Can you do a PRAM reset with an external USB keyboard?

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: Hi dukefawks, I was unable to do pram reset with external either.I am not convinced that it even detects the keyboard as no lights are present on the external keyboard

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: This one is going to suck. It could be some weird USB issue. Have you disconnected everything and just using external keyboard?

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: ok, only battery, speakers and fans plugged in, i get chime but no reaction to the reset key combination. tried both usb ports and the keyboard works on other systems.

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: I have no ideas anymore really. Could be a BIOS issue, do you have a programmer to flash it?

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: no I dont. Would you say that the fact that I am unable to perform PRAM reset indicates bios issues? Is there a way I could confirm it prior to bios replacement?

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: Only way to find out is to flash it. If you do make sure you have a backup first! Go get a TL866 if you are planning on doing more repairs in the future.

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message:
Thank you for the advice. Sorry to be a pain, this bios flashing utility is new to me, do I need any special adapters or the programmer on its own is fine? I can get this in uk [url]http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/TL866CS-Universal-USB-MiniPro-EPROM-FLASH-GAL-AVR-Programmer-UK-STOCK-/192294142620?epid=632468938&hash=item2cc59fc29c:g:XxYAAOSwvihY-1os[/url]

Would that do?
I have experience with other programmers like ip box but have not done any bioses yet

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message:
Yeah that's the one. You'll need to get some DIP to SOIC adapters like these [url]http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/100pcs-SOIC8-SOP8-SO8-SMD-to-DIP8-Adapter-Double-Sides-PCB-Convertor-Board-CF-/272827046558[/url]
Also need to get some pins for those PCBs of course.

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message:
Ok. I got the programmer. I also got the preprogrammed bios chip. I swapped the chips and it is better but extremely slow on boot. I got it up once with a spare disk I have for this model. On clients disk it only let me get to the login in safe mode - and only happened once. Tried booting from Sierra usb stick - it loads the bar fully  which takes around 30 min and just stays there. I run ASD and it failed only on the engine as I am guessing i will need to program in the SN. Any advice how to proceed?
Kind regards

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message:
ME region is fucked up. See how well these Ebay chips work?

Upload the original BIOS here and I will fix it. Also provide the original serial number of the machine.

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)

Hi,
Thank you for the quick reply!
I tried that bios as it supposed to arrive quicker than the programmer. At least some progress :)
I've dumped the BIOS - I hope I have done it right - chose first model after running autodetect. File is too large for me to upload here but here is the google drive link to it
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8-MfTNhrDhZbFZsbmY2MnRGMXM[/url]

I would love to learn to program them right myself - checked a few videos already. Do you have a recommendation on learning material?

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message:
Hi,

Thank you for the bios.
I've programmed the chip, poped it on and it booted straight away.
 Issue is it wont do that again. I shut it down and its back to square one :/
the chip is on the board - checked the legs and pads.
No chime now :/

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: Yup I have a board with exact the same issue here. I have not figured this out

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message:
ok. when i unplug the battery and let it like that for a couple of minutes then it boots again, only once thou. But i can alwatys repeat it and it starts up. ASD is showing some new errors: Detected Trackpad Error (trackpad works), ERROR 8000000E when testing SensorGroupLimits.prm.  Biggest issue i guess that when asd tried testing Sleep?wake it went black - fans spinning and nothing - had to disconnect the battery after 20 min
:( I know next to nothing about the board repair - my guess is that some static builds up and wont drain until I disconnect the battery - when i disconnect the battery and touch the bios legs with a metal tool I can plug the battery back in and it boots without waiting

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message:
Could it be a faulty trackpad? I've fixed a macbook air that only enter safemode. The faulty trackpad's cursor is working fine. But its keep entering safemode and making system super slow to boot. so i swapped the trackpad then did a pram reset and everything working afterward. Yes without pramreset, the system still entering safemode.

I then put the faulty trackpad into other macbook for testing and its causing entering safemode again and pramreset was require.

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: Did the BIOS chip have a clean ME region?

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: Yes BIOS has clean ME. I doubt the trackpad would cause this, but disconnect it. Fans will run high and machine will be slow but it should work.

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message:
I did disconnect the trackpad - chime, white screen , no logo, but i think its because it was off for long. when trying again i got no chime black screen.
I will go through the whole board again maybe I missed something

title: 820-3662-a backlight but probably no picture (?)
message: Nah 3662 boards with these issues are hopeless. I havent figured this out.
